an4.167:1.1: Then Venerable Sāriputta went up to Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.167:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Sāriputta sat down to one side and said to Mahāmoggallāna:
an4.167:2.1: “Reverend Moggallāna, there are four ways of practice.
an4.167:2.5: pleasant practice with slow insight, and
an4.167:2.7: These are the four ways of practice.
an4.167:2.8: Which one of these four ways of practice did you rely on to free your mind from defilements by not grasping?”
an4.167:3.5: I relied on the painful practice with swift insight to free my mind from defilements by not grasping.”
